Dear Ms.Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150 Incident reporting.
Section (3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without legal
Description permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/ legal guardian or next
of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth went AWOL on 1/10/24 and was wearing shorts, socks, and
a jacket. The facility did not report youth missing until youth had
been gone for 40 minutes. They reported he was only missing for
15 minutes. Youth has been returned to the facility.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on January 12,
2024, and reported an officer saw Youth A walking in town
and about a half hour later a call came in from the facility
reporting Youth A as AWOL. The complainant stated if the
facility would have made the call earlier reporting Youth A as
AWOL, the officer could have picked up Youth A. The
complainant reported when the facility made the call, they said
Youth A had not been seen in 15 minutes, but it would have been
more like 30 minutes.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 16, 2024. Director reported he had video and screen
shots of Youth A leaving the facility, staff following out the unit
door, cars driving past the guard shack searching and Operations
2

Manager driving past the guard shack leaving the premises to
continue the search for Youth A on January 10, 2024. Director
showed a group text from Staff 1 at 4:44pm reporting Youth A was
headed toward Camp 2. Director reported there were group texts
at 4:50pm and 4:55pm saying staff were headed toward that area
and searching for Youth A. Director showed me a screen shot of
a call to 911 at 5:16pm lasting 4 minutes reporting Youth A as
AWOL.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
16, 2024. Staff 1 described Youth A laying on his bed, getting out
of bed, walking toward Staff 1 then bolting out the unit door. Staff
1 reported he did not have a radio on him, so he ran to the office,
checked in with Staff 2 (who was with two youth in the backroom
of the unit), told Staff 2 Youth A left the unit and he was going
after him. Staff 1 stated Staff 2 reported over the radio Youth A
left the unit and Staff 1 was going to follow Youth A. Staff 1 stated
he followed Youth A down the drive, in between the trees and
around campus. Staff 1 stated he last saw Youth A head toward
Camp 2, move around the building, and disappear from line of
sight. Staff 1 reported he did not know the specific time he lost
sight of Youth A. Staff 1 reported he continued to Camp 2 looked
all around the building and did the same at the gym. Staff 1 stated
Youth A had run the previous day and went into the gym. Staff 1
stated Supervisor and other staff members were also searching
for Youth A. Staff 1 described Operations Manager meeting him
with a car, Staff 1 getting in the car and both driving around
campus looking for Youth A. Staff 1 stated he returned to the unit
after searching for Youth A by car. Staff 1 was not sure how long
Youth A was gone prior to being called in as AWOL. Staff 1
stated he had visual of Youth A until Youth A went behind the
building of Camp 2. Staff 1 stated a supervisor would have
reported Youth A as AWOL. Staff 1 reported after a youth is out
of line of sight for 15 minutes, they are considered AWOL and
should be reported as such.
Operations Manager (OM) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on January 16, 2024. OM described receiving a group
text from Supervisor stating Youth A had walked out of his
building. OM reported getting in the car and searching the
campus for Youth A. OM denied ever seeing Youth A until the
police had located him. OM stated Staff 1 and Supervisor were
the last ones to have visual on Youth A. OM showed me her cell
phone to look at the group text messages. Text message at
4:37pm Youth A ran out of the building sent by Supervisor,
4:38pm running toward Camp 3 sent by Supervisor, 4:40pm
3

headed that way sent by OM, 5:11pm call Youth A in as AWOL
sent by OM. OM stated Supervisor would have been the one to
call 911 and report Youth A as AWOL.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 16, 2024. Youth A stated he did not want to talk but
eventually agreed to answer some questions. Youth A described
running out of the building and a staff member following him.
Youth A could not recall who followed him but stated there was
more than one staff in the woods. Youth A stated he was followed
for “awhile” by staff but eventually was able to “lose them.” Youth
A reported staff did what they could to find him, but he was able to
lose them. Youth A could not recall if he saw any police driving on
the road prior to being picked up. Youth A did not want to answer
any more questions and asked to leave.
Worker was interviewed via telephone on January 17, 2024.
Worker reported being notified by the facility after Youth A
returned from being AWOL. Worker stated she is always notified
of an AWOL situation, but it is when the youth has returned, not
when they first go AWOL. Worker reported she did not have any
concerns with the facility.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on January 31,
2024. Supervisor described Youth A running out the front door
and Staff 1 and herself running after Youth A. Supervisor stated
the last eyes on Youth A was by Staff 1 when Youth A was
running toward Camp 2. Supervisor reported Youth A had run
earlier and went into the gym, so staff wanted to look in the gym
and around the other camps prior to reporting Youth A AWOL.
Supervisor stated OM had been contacted and was helping
search the cabins. Supervisor reported multiple staff searched the
gym and cabins for Youth A and after 15 minutes of not having
eyes Supervisor called 911. Supervisor did not have the specific
times of when Youth A was last seen but stated 911 was
contacted about 5:17pm or 5:18pm. Supervisor stated she never
had eyes on Youth A after he left the facility.
I was not notified as the assigned DCWL consultant of Youth A
going AWOL from the facility on 1/10/2024 at 10:29pm.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of Youth A going AWOL on January 10, 2024, was
reviewed with Director on January 16, 2024. Video shows Youth
A run out the unit door at 4:36:43 and Staff 1 run out the door at
4:37:09. There is no video once Youth A leaves the unit.
4

Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 171730213 for Youth A going AWOL. The incident
report is consistent with staff and youth interviews.
• Truancy Policy and Procedure: Policy reads, Local law
enforcement personnel will be notified immediately and
referring agency worker will be notified within one hour.
The policy also reads, once a client returns, all other parties
notified of truancy must also be notified at the time of
return.
• Vassar Police Department Case Report 240000055
regarding Youth A’s AWOL. Report indicates on
1/10/2024, at approximately 1720 hours an officer was
dispatched to the facility for a runaway juvenile. The officer
was told Youth A was last seen by staff walking near Camp
3, approximately 15 minutes prior to calling 911. The same
officer who was dispatched noted in the police report he
observed Youth A on Water Street, at approximately 1650
hours, approximately 26 minutes before the facility reported
Youth A AWOL.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance for not notifying the
licensing authority and referring agency of Youth A’s AWOL until
Youth A returned to the facility. The facility had been making
notifications of a youths’ AWOL once the youths returned, not
when the youths first went AWOL. The facility was unaware they
needed to notify when a youth first went AWOL.
The facility notified law enforcement at 5:16pm of Youth A’s
AWOL. Text messages indicate Youth A was last seen at
4:38pm. Staff 1, OM, and Supervisor reported searching the gym
and cabins, not locating Youth A, and then contacting 911. The
call was made to 911 approximately 38 minutes after staff last had
eyes on Youth A.
Technical Assistance:
The agency should review and update Truancy policy to ensure it
is clear when a youth is considered AWOL vs truant and that all
parties are to be notified immediately when youth is determined
AWOL, not within 1 hour or other specific timeframes.
It was recommended to the facility staff are trained to notify the
licensing authority and referring agency of youths going AWOL
once it has been determined youths are AWOL, not only when
youths return to the facility.
Conclusion Violation Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
